FROM: Connie Malackey, Receptionist
 TO: Joe Shert, Receptionist
 RE: Ghosts!?

 Joe!  After we heard those weird noises the other night, I talked to some of the nurses.
 We aren't the only ones!  Everyone has heard weird noises coming from the walls.
 Do you think this place is haunted!?

FROM: Bryan Rooters, Reception Manager
 TO: Joe Shert, Receptionist
 RE: Performance Eval

 Hi Joe.
 Your 90-day performance evaluation is due.  Please plan to meet with me in my office on Tuesday.
 Thanks.

FROM: Bryan Rooters, Reception Manager
 TO: Receptionists
 RE: Housekeeping

 Hi team,
 Please be aware that the decision has been made to let go some of the housekeeping staff.
 This decision was made by management to ensure that our operation can run as smoothly and efficiently as possible by passing on these cost savings to the residents.
 To keep up with our high standards of elder care, I will be assigning some additional small tasks to you in the near future.
 As you know, here at Shady Hills we value each and every employee and see this as an excellent opportunity to grow, learn, and provide for the Shady Hills family.
 Please let me know if you have any questions.
 Thanks.

FROM: Connie Malackey, Receptionist
 TO: Joe Shert, Receptionist
 RE: Mrs.  Palmero

 Hi Joe.
 So - you know how Mrs.  Palmero has been acting weird and constantly talking about baking cookies?
 I was talking to one of the nurses and they said that Mrs.  Palmero was prescribed this new medicine?
 It's this weird powder stuff.  Apparently the nurses aren't even qualified to give it to her - she needs a special doctor to come in every day!
 Crazy, right?  I wish all I had to worry about was baking cookiesâ€¦

FROM: Kristi Gordee, SVP Operations
 TO: Bryan Rooters, Reception Manager
 RE: Do Your Job

 Bryan,
 Do you not conduct thorough background checks and reviews on new hires?  Joe is related to the Mayor of Springfield.  His 90 day New Employee evaluation is coming up.  Do your job.

FROM: Joe Shert, Receptionist
 TO: Bryan Rooters, Reception Manager
 RE: Performance Evaluation

 Hi Mr. Rooters, I look forward to seeing you Tuesday for my evaluation.  I've been working really hard to show that I am Shady Hills material!

FROM: Kristi Gordee, SVP Operations
 TO: Bryan Rooters, Reception Manager
 RE: Connie Malackey

 Bryan,
 Connie has been asking a lot of weird questions about 'Ghosts' and other such nonsense.
 This could look bad for us.  To make it worse, she is hanging out with Joe Shert a lot.
 Shut it down.

FROM: Joe Shert, Receptionist
 TO: Bryan Rooters, Reception Manager
 RE: Housekeeping

 Hi Mr. Rooters, with all due respect I feel that I may have been assigned more of these tasks than the other Receptionists.
 Jim said he hasn't had to do any cleaning in two weeks, yet I have been on cleaning duty 3 times.
 To be clear, I certainly do not mind the extra work!  I just want to ensure you're aware in case there is a computer glitch.
 Thank you and have a great day!

FROM: Amanda Hugentskis, Receptionist
 TO: Bryan Rooters, Reception Manager
 RE: Housekeeping

 Seriously?  This is ridiculous.  This place was a mess even with housekeeping personnel.
 I quit.

dynamic_line:
EMPLOYEE NAME: Joseph Shert
 EMPLOYEE TITLE: Receptionist
 REVIEW DATE: 06-xx-xxxx
 REVIEW BY: Bryan Rooters, Reception Manager

 Joseph is always on time for work and gets along well with coworkers.  However, he has trouble taking direction and often speaks out against his superiors [See attached email: Housekeeping].
 Joe speaks a big game but unfortunately does not perform to the Shady Hills standard.
 As our standard is extremely important for the health and wellbeing of our residents, I have no choice but to recommend termination.

 Signed,
 Bryan Rooters
 Reception Manager

EMPLOYEE NAME: Connie Malackey
 EMPLOYEE TITLE: Receptionist
 REVIEW DATE: 05-xx-xxxx
 REVIEW BY: Bryan Rooters, Reception Manager

 Connie gets along well with coworkers.  I have occasionally needed to remind her to start work on time as clocking in late is detrimental to other employees and, ultimately, our precious residents.  Connie works hard on assigned tasks but often lacks the drive to seek out additional tasks.
 I am recommending a generous 0.5% pay wage increase per corporate policy.

 Signed,
 Bryan Rooters
 Reception Manager

Shady Hills Nursing Home.
 You are logged in as: Kristi Gordee, SVP Operations.

FROM: Leah Shepherds
 TO: Kristi Gordee, SVP Operations
 RE: I am going to sue you

 I don't know what kind of sick game your sham of a home is playing, but I am getting to the bottom of it.
 I've hired a lawyer and we are going to sue you.
 I should never have left grandpa in your care.
 How does a PERSON go missing from a NURSING HOME!?  I have pictures of how dirty and disgusting that place is.
 You should be ashamed!

FROM: Kristi Gordee, SVP Operations
 TO: Peter St. Travers, SVP Research & Development
 RE: Shepherds

 Peter,
 Leah Shepherds keeps sending me emails, and we just received the papers for yet another lawsuit.
 I don't know what you're thinking but this one is going to be really difficult and could cost us.
 The Board is going to be furious.

FROM: Vincent Fuels, Researcher
 TO: Peter St. Travers, SVP Research & Development
 RE: This is bad!

 While you were gone last night, the old man started to wake up and become cranky.
 We had to give him another dose of that elephant tranquilizer!
 I think he might actually be strong enough to break out of his cell now.
 We really need to do something before he kills someone!
 I know this experiment meant a lot to you, but it isn't worth the risk anymore!

FROM: Kristi Gordee, SVP Operations
 TO: Peter St. Travers, SVP Research & Development
 RE: Budget

 Peter,
 You need to find a way to reverse what you did ASAP.
 What exactly do you expect me to do to get us out of this?
 The police are investigating us now for foul play.

FROM: Unknown Sender
 TO: Peter St. Travers, SVP Research & Development
 RE: Results

 Looking forward to your report at the next meeting.
 I put a lot on the line for you, don't disappoint me, Peter.
 Get me results.

FROM: Will Higgins, VP Information Technology
 TO: Peter St. Travers, SVP Research & Development
 RE: Security

 Hello sir,
 I understand your concerns about security.  Rest assured, myself and my team take this very seriously.  I assure you that high-level encryption protects all of our systems.
 Nobody will be able to access any of our PCs without use of the owner's fingerprint authentication, even in the event that the main power supply is cut.
 Nobody unauthorized will ever be able to read our emails or documents.

Shady Hills Corporation.
 You are logged in as: Peter St. Travers, SVP Research & Development.

PROJECT PROCEDURES: Big Pappy
 PAGE 1

 1) Review patients for possible induction.  As a failsafe, patients selected for this program should have minimal or no contact with outside individuals and should additionally not be removed from their assigned rooms for longer than two days.  See 'Chapter 1: Induction' for greater detail.
 2) Administer standard alchemical dosage according to patient profile.  See 'Chapter 2: Dosages' on typical process.
 3) Monitor results over 7 days.  Patient will remain in general population outside of scheduled physicals unless determined otherwise by SVP Research & Development.
 4) Patients deemed unworthy for general population are to remain in Secure lab room for special monitoring.  Official documentation will denote hospitalization in this circumstance to mitigate chance of suspicion.
 5) To ensure unbiased compliance, selected patients and their families will not be informed of this process.

PROJECT PROCEDURES: Big Pappy
 Goals

 1) Study effects of cognitive and physical decline in geriatric residents.
 2) Study effects of advanced medical and mutagenic serums on select patients.
 3) Eliminate, or reverse, the physical and mental aging process in humans.

PROJECT CODE NAME: 'Big Pappy'
 PROJECT RESIDENT: Pablo Shepherds
 PROJECT STATUS: Active
 PROJECT START DATE: xx-xx-xxxx

 Entry Log 1: Started subject on assigned dosage.  Will monitor over 7 days.
 Entry Log 2: Subject within expected parameters.  Subject will remain in general population.
 Entry Log 3: Subject within expected parameters.  Subject will remain in general population.
 Entry Log 4: Subject showing signs of severe dementia.  Unexpected result.  Following removal protocol.  Moving patient to Secure room for 2 day period.
 Entry log 5: Subject stabilizing.  Attempting RA21E dosage.
 Entry Log 6: Subject within expected parameters.  Returning to general population.
 Entry Log 7: Subject within expected parameters.  Attempting Mutagenic Serum dose.  Following removal protocol.  Moving patient to Secure room for 2 day period.
 Entry Log 8: Subject has shown tremendous increase in girth and power.  Reduction in cognitive decline.  Symptoms of dementia nearly eliminated.
 Entry Log 9: Subject becoming belligerent.  Unknown cause.  Purifier Serum failing.  Initiated sedation protocol.  15mg Carfentanil required.  Initiating Failsafe protocol; subject cannot be returned to general population.
 Entry Log 10: Subject remains sedated.  Maintaining Failsafe protocol.  Attempting purifier serum trial.
